4649684/4646438/4650042.title: Rheumatism
4649684/4646438/4650042.text: Rheumatism:My father, Joseph Glancy told me that small houses used to be erected near streams, in which fires were kindled in order to raise the temperature to as high a degree as possible. The sufferers used to go into those houses and remain in them until they were in a bath of perspiration. Then they used to rush out and plunge into the stream close by. Doing this twice is supposed to cure them.

4649689/4647440/4650777.title: A Cure for Rheumatism
4649689/4647440/4650777.text: A Cure for RheumatismMy Father,Age 48. Patrick O'Boy, Drumigna , Keshcarrigan, told me that it is a common belief in my locality that rheumatism can be cured in the following way.The person who wants to get cured should go out and look for nine frogs.This person should not come back until he has found the nine.If he does come back he will not get cursed.When he has got the nine frogs he can throw away the first eight and keep the ninth. He must bring home the ninth and boil him in water. When he is boiled the water in which he is boiled in can be rubbed to where the rheumatism is and it is believed to be a good cure.Conn O'Boy , 26-11-1937

5044783/5037715/5083736.title: Local Cures - The Head Fever
5044783/5037715/5083736.text: The chief symptom of head fever is a violent and sickening pain in the head. Yes I myself had the head fever when I was fifteen years of age. I was suffering from it for weeks before it was diagnosed, but I was then as weakened by it that I was not able to walk. Well, there was an old woman a Mrs Costello living at the time in Tullylacken Mór who had the cure and I was brought there.After some prayers, she measured my head from back round to the to of my nose and then using the same string she measured my head again but this time from the under point of chin to the top, telling me at the same time that if I hadn't it the two measurements would correspond.The finding was that the string that measured my head from back to front as stated above wanted 6 or 7 inches of meeting when my head was measured by it in the upward direction. She then told me that my head was so much opened and she prayed and pressed my head inwards with her hands having on at each side of my head. This was on a certain Thursday and she made the cure again on the following Monday when she showed me that my head had closed in by about 3". I had to go back to have the cure made again - a Monday and last time on the following Thursday after which I was completely cured by this good old lady - RIP

5008975/4972644/5112271.text: 23There was a man living in Ballivor a few years ago and he had the cure of rheumatism.  His name was Larry Gaffney.  He had three magic stones, these he would put into a basin.  Then he would go to a river dividing two parishes and rise a bottle of water opposite the way the river is running.  Then he would pour the water into the basin with the three stones.  He would wash the person with the rheumatism in this water, and say certain prayers.  This would have to be done once a week until the person would be cured.  He would have to rise the water before twelve oclock a.m. and throw it back again.

4921833/4895424/5183512.title: A Receipt for the Ague
4921833/4895424/5183512.text:
Take 4 ozs of best Cark (sic) finely powdered; 2 drams of salt of wormwood; 2 drams of salt of Centaury; 1 grain of mace powdered.   These to be mixed with the syrup of wormwood and made into pills to the size of a large nutmeg, two of which to be taken every two hours until the entire is taken, which will in the sixth turn, if the patient shakes every day it must be taken when the fit is off but if on every second day begin on the well day early in the morning washing it down with a spoonful of whey or plain water. This is an infallible cure.

It was then boiled and applied as a poultice.There is a story told locally of a man who went to the priest to ask him to cure his Rheumatism. He was very surprised when the priest told him to go home and pull a good armful of nettles. Then he was told to strip the limb naked and if he had any body at home he was to ask some one to beat the limb with the nettles until there would not be a leaf left on them.The man at dirt thought the priest was joking him. but as the pain continued he said he would try the priests cure.
